metaTags.metaTitle: Accelerate Internet Apps | Increase Conversion Rates
metaTags.metaDescription: Deliver fast, rich user experiences for Internet applications to increase customer engagement and conversion rates. Speed up websites and web applications.

relatedBlades.title: Accelerate Web Applications
relatedBlades.copy:
Today's web pages are increasingly complex with a globally dispersed audience, which can degrade the user experience. 

Cloudflare increases web application performance by bringing content closer to your users, caching static content on its network, optimizing image files, compressing dynamic content, routing requests to the least congested path, and much more.

imageAssetFile.altText: Ensure application accelerate mobile experiences spot illustration
imageAssetFile.title: Ensure application accelerate mobile experiences spot illustration

features.title: Global Scale
features.description: Cloudflare's global Anycast network spans %{DataCenterCount} cities in %{CountryCount} countries, reducing latency and time to first byte by delivering content closest to visitors.

features.title: Ease of Use
features.description: Setting up Cloudflare takes as little as 5 minutes. The easy-to-use dashboard enables quick configuration of fine-grained functionalities to improve the performance of complex applications.

features.title: Integrated Security & Performance
features.description: Cloudflare includes integrated security services to defend against DDoS attacks, customer data breaches, and abusive bots, while preventing performance trade-offs.

relatedBlades.title: Heavy, complex web pages
relatedBlades.copy: Average page size continues to increase due to complex CSS, high-quality images and video assets, or extensive usage of javascript snippets. Larger web page sizes (the 'payload') increases the amount of data which must travel over the network to be rendered by the visitor's browser, slowing down loading speeds.

imageAssetFile.altText: Icon depicting a laptop with a webpage loaded in the browser.
imageAssetFile.title: diagram-heavy-webpage

relatedBlades.title: Interactivity and Personalization
relatedBlades.copy: When applications use APIs to fetch dynamic content to support personalization and interactivity, the number of connections and trips to origin infrastructure increases, resulting in performance degradations and poor visitor experiences.

imageAssetFile.altText: Diagram depicting the number of trips to the origin made when APIs fetch dynamic content to support personalization.
imageAssetFile.title: diagram-more-trips-to-origin

relatedBlades.title: Globally Distributed Visitors
relatedBlades.copy: As modern web page visitors become more globally dispersed, content must travel longer distances, sometimes to countries with slow or unreliable networks. For example, a website with an origin server in San Francisco might have an equal number of global visitors as it does local and global visitors will experience increases in latency.

imageAssetFile.altText: A diagram depicting how content must travel as webpages become more globally dispersed.
imageAssetFile.title: diagram-global-dist-users

relatedBlades.title: Cloudflare's Performance Services
relatedBlades.copy: Every Cloudflare data center runs an integrated stack of performance features which address the most common causes of poor performance. These features help solve many of the core problems that slow down the delivery of applications over the Internet. From fast web address lookups to accelerated delivery to the origin server, Cloudflare speeds up traffic at key points in the life of a request.

imageAssetFile.altText: Digram depicting Cloudflare's web performance services
imageAssetFile.title: Diagram web performance services

content.value: Mobile clients introduce performance and content delivery constraints which hurt user experiences. Deliver fast mobile experiences that increase engagement and conversions, regardless of distance to origin servers, device types, or network health.

content.value: Overloaded or unavailable infrastructure prevents users from accessing applications. Keep Internet applications fast, available, and scalable, even during unexpected traffic spikes or infrastructure outages.
